page.title: 17A MOORLAND FARM
page.content: {From Grid Square 7526} Nigher Friar Hill Farm is located in the Green Haworth district of Hyndburn. The farmhouse is fairly typical of agricultural dwellings found in upland areas of the Peninne fringe. The house itself is about two hundred years old, built from locally quarried sandstone and roofed with flagstone also found in this area of North East Lancashire. Surrounding the farm buildings are nineteen acres of fields in which cattle and two horses graze. The occupier pursues farming as a hobby and is concerned mainly with beef and poultry farming . The present stock consists of ten bullocks, ten heifers, one bull, two calves and thirty hens. Some of the cattle live in the byre and the others live in the fields.
